Anyway I just updated to 128 ESR and I was able to get the font sizes OK, but there are some things I liked that are missing.

1) Above the folders column that shows all the various inboxes and other folders there used to be a button labeled "Get Messages Now". Now there is a button that says "+New Message" . How do I get the Get Messages Now button back?

2) The folders used to display the total messages in a folder in one column and the number unread in another column. Now it just displays the number unread. How do I get the total messages in the folder column back?

title: Mail keeps vanishing, and other problems
content:
I have been having multiple, and increasing, problems since the most recent update:

  • When I load TBird, it says "No message found" and my mailbox appears empty.
  • After I enter my password, my existing mail appears.
  • Program freezes up if I try to do anything while it's checking for new messages, I can't read or respond to messages until it's finished downloading. (I used to be able to do this.)
  • "Leave messages on server" is set to OFF, but the program frequently downloads duplicate messages after downloading mail. It is also checking for new messages much too often.
  • When I delete a message from my inbox or move one to a folder, all the mail vanishes again and I need to close the program and restart.

All of this is making what should be minor actions take forever, and I'm worried about the problems getting worse and immobilizing me. Would greatly appreciate any help. Thank you!
creator: elkatd

title: OAuth2 support for hosted email providers
content:
Hi,

One my customer is looking for OAuth2 support for their hosted email services. After lot of research I came to know that Oauth provider URLS and clientids are hard-coded in OAuth2Providers.jsm

https://fossies.org/linux/seamonkey/comm/mailnews/base/util/OAuth2Providers.jsm

As per my understanding it is not feasible to customize OAuth2 providers without modifying above file. Also it looks like OAuth providers have monopolized the email service market by few vendors like Gmail, Outlook. vy offering Multi-Factor based authentication and passowrd less authentication which is MUST have security feature from many of our customers. It is really against OpenSource philosohy and there is no scope small/medium/large service provider to host OAuth2 service.

My customer is interested looking for customizable provider and will be ready to pay for this feature.

As I know TB has no commericial support, but I would like to understand if it feasible with some sort of commecial agreement

Thanks, Himanshu
creator: himanshuj_mohan

title: thunderbird migratie naar nieuwe machine
content:
Hallo,

Bij een migratie van een oude iMac (MacOS Ventura) naar een nieuwe PowerBook M4 (MacOS Sequoia) krijg ik de melding dat “Thunderbird v128.6” beschadigd is …. En dus niet meer bruikbaar.

Ik heb van de oude iMac de volledige map Thunderbird User /Bibliotheek/Thunderbird A. Klassiek gekopieerd (Copy-paste) naar externe SSD B. Via het voorgestelde wijze met Control -> Kopieer en Plak via externe SSD Dan deze map geplakt op delfde plaats in de Bibliotheek op de MacBook M4. De gemigreerde TB-app verwijderd en een nieuw geïnstalleerd. Na de vervanging vindt “TB v128.6.1” de DATA (email-adressen en alle emails) NIET meer, de adressen,….. wel.

Wat doe ik verkeerd ?

Hoe nu oplossen? Rudy

in hetEngels

During a migration from an old iMac (MacOS Ventura) to a new PowerBook M4 (MacOS Sequoia), I receive the message that "Thunderbird v128.6" is corrupted and therefore no longer usable.I copied the entire folder Thunderbird User / Library / Thunderbird from the old iMac: A. Classic copy-paste to an external SSD B. Via the suggested method with Control -> Copy and Paste via the external SSD. Then I pasted this folder in the same location in the Library on the MacBook M4.The migrated TB app was deleted and a new one was installed.After this replacement, "TB v128.6.1" can no longer find the DATA (email addresses and all emails), only the addresses are available.What am I doing wrong?How can I resolve this?Rudy
creator: rudy.v

Also, the white square overlays all other running applications, so that anything full screen has the red and yellow close/minimize buttons hidden.

This happens whether Thunderbird is the only application running or if others are running.

It is driving me mad. Any insights how to fix it?

title: Thunderbird on Debian - How to enforce Antivirus setting to be enabled?
content:
Hi everyone, I have a fleet of machines running debian and I would like the Thunderbird setting "Allow antivirus clients to quarantine individual incoming messages" to be always enabled.

It doesn't appear to be supported by the policies.json method of setting it up.

Is there a way to enforce it?

I'm also aware of the option to create an user.js file in the profile folder with the content "user_pref("mailnews.downloadToTempFile", true);"

But this method requires to create the profile first and then know it's location. Is there a "profile template" that I can edit to set that preference how I need it?

Thank you in advance Lore

title: file size of attachments
content:
This is just a curiosity. When I attach files to TBird emails it always shows the size of the attachments. When the attachments are large enough, I get a warning asking me if I really want to send them or if I should use a file sharing app. What I find curious is that the warning always shows a file size substantially larger than what TBird does. For example, today I wanted to share a file the both TBird and my Win file manager said was 32MB, but the warning said I was trying to send a file that was 48MB.

Why is that? Does TBird have additional data it attaches to the sent message that increase the file size substantially?

title: Cannot print emails
content:

content:

title: Thunderbird: aggiungere nuovi account di posta su dominio con provider Aruba [Era: Non riesco ad aggiungere altri nuovi account di posta]
content:
Buongiorno, spero che qualcuno mi possa aiutare perchè non riesco a venirne a capo.

Ho inserito due account con protocollo IMAP, ma per il terzo mi da sempre errore "Impossibile autenticarsi sul server. La configurazione, il nome utente o la password potrebbero essere errati". Eppure è tutto corretto..

Mi spiego nel dettaglio.

Il primo di gmail, ed è tutto ok (in automatico).

Il secondo account con il nome a dominio (che chiamerò "nomecasella01@nomedominio.it"). Il provider del dominio è ARUBA e la configurazione in manuale è stata la seguente:

Indirizzo email: nomecasella01@nomedominio.it Password: password della casella email in questione (che chiamerò "password01") Server in entrata: imaps.aruba.it Porta: 993 sicurezza: SSL/TLS Autenticazione: password normale Nome utente: nomecasella01@nomedominio.it Server in uscita: smtps.aruba.it Porta: 465 sicurezza SSL/TLS Nome utente: nomecasella01@nomedominio.it

E ha funzionato. Sino a qui tutto ok.

Per il terzo account, sempre con lo stesso nome a dominio e provider ARUBA, ho utilizzato la stessa modalità del secondo, ma con indirizzo email e password specifici della seconda casella "nomecasella02@nomedominio.it" (e password02)

Ebbene, mi da sempre errore "Impossibile autenticarsi sul server. La configurazione, il nome utente o la password potrebbero essere errati".

Com'è possibile? Ho controllato e ricontrollato tutto e la correttezza della password, ma da sempre lo stesso errore.

Chi riesce a capire e ad aiutarmi?

Grazie!

Un saluto, Maurizio

title: Moving my Thunderbird profile to a different drive
content:
I'm running Win10 and Thunderbird 128.6.0esr. I wanted to move my profile from C: to a different drive (in my case, the D drive). I Googled and got lots of hits, both on the Thunderbird support site and elsewhere, that seemed to indicate to me that some users were seemingly having issues getting this task completed.

Also, looking around in my Windows "AppData" subdirectories, I noticed that there are actually two "profile" directories.

For example: C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\abcdefgh.default C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\abcdefgh.default

Many of the instructions I found were dated from two years ago or more and only discussed moving one profile directory (the one in "Roaming") and I wondered if, in the interim, there's been an addition of a second profile directory that wasn't being addressed in the "old" instructions I was finding on the Web.

So instead of trying any of the suggested procedures I decided to try something else that seemed to be simpler and more straightforward to me. After performing the process I decided to try, testing seems to indicate it works just fine. However, I thought I'd leave this message to ask if there's some issue that can result by doing it as I did.

All I did was to create a new directory on my D drive to hold to two profile directories. Inside this new directory, I created two subdirectories called "AppData-Local" and "AppData-Roaming" to hold the two respective profile directories. With Thunderbird closed, I then copied the two original profile directories into their new respective directories on the D drive:

D:\Thunderbird Profiles\AppData-Local\abcdefgh.default D:\Thunderbird Profiles\AppData-Roaming\abcdefgh.default

Just to be safe, I then renamed the original profile directories under the "...\AppData\..." directory on C: so that if my idea went south, I could just restore the original configuration easily because they weren't deleted. So the original profile directories became...

C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\abcdefgh.default.delete_me C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\abcdefgh.default.delete_me

All that was left was to open a Windows "cmd" console window (running as administrator) and create a symbolic link in each of the original directories on the C drive that point to the new locations of the directories on the D drive:

C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles>mklink /D "abcdefgh.default" "D:\Thunderbird Profiles\AppData-Roaming\abcdefgh.default"

C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles>mklink /D "abcdefgh.default" "D:\Thunderbird Profiles\AppData-Local\abcdefgh.default"

(Note that I changed the "current directory" before running each "mklink" command to put the symlink in the right directory.)

Then, I started up Thunderbird and... it was as if nothing happened. Everything (old messages, settings, etc.) was still there exactly as before. So far, my limited testing seems to indicate that this process worked without a hitch. I even tried the Thunderbird "backup profile" feature and it created a zip file that seems to contain a subset of the contents of the "Roaming" profile directory, which I suspect is perhaps all that really needs to be saved in a profile backup? Right?

Just in case, I haven't deleted the original, but renamed, profile directories yet. I thought I'd post this message and see if anyone has a reason why moving the profile to a different drive by this symlink process is a "big mistake." Or even a "little mistake" for that matter.
creator: sbear45

I have rebooted, shut down and restarted, been all through the forums and tried various fixes related to settings but nothing has worked to return the subfolders. I have read in some of the responses about TB profiles. I followed the instructions to find them and did discover that there is one from a couple of days ago. I also have a recent backup where I could probably find that folder. I'm not sure what to do with it, however and hoped someone here can guide me regarding this problem. A curious thing that may be a clue is that I used Outlook for Mac a long time so I opened it in lieu of TB not working. Outlook was missing the same subfolders. Also I opened Apple Mail, all the subfolders were in tact and though I receive messages fine, it won't let me send a message. I get this alert:

"Cannot send message using the server iCloud Verify that you have addressed this message correctly. Check your SMTP server settings in Mail preferences and verify any advanced settings with your system administrator. The server response was: <syn-076-180-144-237.res.spectrum.com76.180.144.237)>: Client host rejected: Access denied Select a different outgoing mail server from the list below or click Try Later to leave the message in your Outbox until it can be sent."

I have a gMail account and that didn't let me send either.
